Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility based on alleged complicity in international crimes
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Sections 4-7 of the Crimes Against Humanity and War Crimes Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Reasonable grounds to believe complicity in genocide
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Crimes Against Humanity and War Crimes Act, Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonable grounds (lower than balance of probabilities)
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Credible evidence showing a serious possibility of complicity
Evidence_Type: Lack of direct evidentiary link to specific crimes
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (federal immigration and judicial review jurisdiction)
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Monitoring communications for SLA with knowledge of resulting killings
Crimes.Temporal_Context: During active conflict involving the SLA
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Ms. Haddad's admissions and role in SLA activities
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Crimes Against Humanity and War Crimes Act
Complaint_Issues: Lack of clarity in legal reasoning
Crimes.Credibility: Admissions accepted but not sufficiently linked to crimes
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections 4-7 of the Crimes Against Humanity and War Crimes Act
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Complicity in international crimes under Canadian law
